name: Cheddar Woods Holiday Home Park

reviews.text: It's a nice campsite which benefits from being in a great location. Cheddar Gorge a stone's throw away, beaches not far away and in the most beautiful countryside. It's definitely a family site, the kids love the adventure play ground which was amazingly well thought out, and the pool is an instant hit. Generally speaking it has everything you would expect but it just didn't hit the spot for us.
reviews.title: It's OK, will depend on your camping "type"

reviews.text: There are a couple of camping fields that are lovely, Piddle Patch and the Ging Gang Goolie field - both at the top of the campsite. Up here the views of the surrounding woodland are amazing and it feels a little more like more basic camping. But I really didn't like the other fields. Lots of organised rows with hedges overlooking your car and right into your opposite neighbours tent. Some rows were really ugly hard standing - I know you need this if you're caravanning, but it just wasn't pretty. Piddle Patch has a slight slope - no big deal and a road that runs to the right hand side. It's a country road so expect intermittent traffic noise, some loud and if you're next to the road be prepared with ear plugs if you feel the road noise will bother you. It's a trek from the nearest facilities. This field could seriously do with another set of toilets up that end.
reviews.title: beautiful caravan park

reviews.text: Which leads me nicely onto the subject of toilets - I've stayed in basic sites with one portaloo that was cleaner than this. I know it was a busy, wet weekend but there is no excuse for toilets with broken toilet seats, toilet paper left strewn around the floor, cigarette ends on the floor from night til the middle of the next day. This is just poor housekeeping and needs to be dealt with by the management team. A small investment here would boost this site no end, A move into more eco showers perhaps and a complete renovation of the toilets is needed.
reviews.title: Clean with excellent facilities

reviews.text: Lots of rubbish around the site as well which is either sad testament to the type of people that pitch here OR a reflection of the lack of general care and attention taken to keep the site looking good.
reviews.title: Short caravan break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all it brought back memories of 1970/80s camping trips with my parents. It's not our cup of tea but it was a lovely camping weekend.
reviews.title: spotless park , friendly staff

reviews.text: Have just returned from a last minute break to Broadway House. Booked through Hoseasons, we stayed in a 6 berth Mendip Champagne caravan. They also sell a strawberry champagne caravan but I think they are the same except for one is 4 berth & Mendip is 6 berth. The site is very well kept with a very large area for tourers & campers. It has a nice club house with games rooms & area with pool tables. There are lots of other things on the site but I will tell you what we thought, rather than something you can find out yourself on their website. At this time of year, it is not too busy, so absolutely fine but I would imagine that in peak season, the club house would not be big enough for the size of this site. The caravans are perfectly adequate, a little dated but very clean & in good working order. However, if you are tall or large (or both) the beds are too small. This is probably the norm in most statics now but it may be worth paying extra and taking a look at their lodges if you like a bigger bed. Also the caravans are really close together, we could just get our car between the 2 spaces of the caravans, so you are talking maybe 7 feet apart. The caravans all have a little decking area which is really nice and the site is very clean. Out of season, this site is lovely and a 3 night price of £95 was a bargain, just be mindful of how close the caravans are and you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Weekend with Hoseasons. Mendip Champagne Caravan

reviews.text: We stayed here for an extended period over the Bank Holiday weekend. It has all the potential to be a great camping site, unfortunately the 'pack em in' mentality of the owners meant it became a nightmare when it was full over this weekend. There are simply not enough toilet/shower facilities for when it is full, and the type of people it atracted this weekend were, for want of a better word, trash campers who left the toilets in a right mess, were noisy and generally just there for a boozy weekend.
reviews.title: Could be much better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My advice for the owners would be to sacrifice the number of spaces available for a more relaxed and spacious feel to the site and which would then mean that the facilities could cope with the reduced numbers.
reviews.title: Would only use if nothing else was available.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It would be a great site with more 'elbow room' between pitches as it is simply too crowded and claustraphobic when full
reviews.title: SUPER HOLIDAY PARK RECOMMEND TO ANYONE

reviews.text: When we arrived the site appeared to look respectable, tidy and warming.
reviews.title: Great long weekend, exceptionally clean in great location!

reviews.text: the pitch we had was sheltered and with nice views of the wooded hills! We stayed in our camper with side awning, and some of the pegs were impossible to get in with normal pegs...but hey!!! Thats not a biggey, just something to sort out! facilities were fine, nothing fancy but equally nothing terrible! we enjoyed our stay here! Very convenient for Cheddar Gorge.
reviews.title: nice sheltered pitches in a picturesque spot

reviews.text: This caravan park is horrendous the caravans are not what are advertised on the net.. The staff are unfriendly, we have four children and the caravan had a damp musty smell, the gas fire did not work and we had no blankets.. We had booked a week but after two days we came home the swimming pool advertised as heated was not, and the clubs entertainment was disgusting with the dj playing 1980s rave music. The food in the restaurant which was filthy was dirty and freezing cold.. This quite frankly is a con do not go they are painting a picture of a lovely holiday and it is awful...
reviews.title: Broadway caravan park chedder Somerset..

reviews.text: we had a great break at broadway house in july loads of things to do on the site we stayed for two nights and it was great.The staff were very helpful.So on the whole a great stay. Mr and Mrs bond.
reviews.title: great hoilday weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from this site........ Having booked a one bedroom Static Caravan as described on their web page. When we arrived the office was closed and we went to the Bar area to get our key. As we entered, there was a very stale and nasty smell, we decided at this point not to use the facilities
reviews.title: Very Disappointing

reviews.text: The van allotted to us was nothing like the one advertised. It was a 10ft narrow van. It was obviously quite old and scruffy. The upholstery was very shabby and quite soiled. When we asked about the 'pull out bed' in the lounge, which is advertised as being available with extra bedding, we were told they don't advertise this because of a health & safety risk (an absolute lie) We found there was no central heating, just a very small wall heater in the bedroom and we were required to use a pay meter for the electricity. . We asked if any other vans were available and were told that they didn 't have anything not even a 2 bed van to give us. We could not sleep in that van When we demanded a return of our money, which we had already paid on booking, the manageress informed us that it was not the policy of the site to give any returns. I then asked to speak to someone else I was told there was no-one. The name of the owners were refused. When I threatened court action as they were not supplying what they advertised we were asked to return the following morning and she would see what she could do. The next day suddenly there was a 2 bedroomed, 12 ft van available, which was acceptable (but still without central heating) but we agreed to take it as we could not afford the cost of other accommodation We found that the car was not allowed outside the van, as advertised and we had to carry our cases over grass for some distance. We are both seniors. We only stayed 3 nights of our 10 booked (having spent the first night in B & B ) as we were so cold during the night. Also we only counted 4 caravans occupied on the static site. We have booked caravans in the past at this time of year on different sites always with central heating. I would never use this site again and still very peeved at our early return and the loss of our money
reviews.title: Broadway House

reviews.text: We went out of season but were blessed with the weather, we camped in 'tinkers nook' which was a minute walk from the shop (open daily), toilet & shower facilities & bar (open fridays & saturdays out of season). The heated pool was shut as it was march but there was lots to do around the area so no problem there!! The site is dog friendly with its own designated 'piddle patch' & woodland walk headed up into the Mendips which back onto the site. There are lodges & static caravans to rent, along with grass pitches for tents & hard pitches for caravans, all of which come with free electric & tv arial points!! This site is great for all the family with a kids playground, bmx track & no steps (apart from into the lodges) so good for older people as well.
reviews.title: Amazing camp/caravan site in a fantastic location with loads to do locally & easily accessible!!!

description: Nestled in the beautiful Mendip Hills, Cheddar Woods is the perfect place to relax and unwind. Breath taking scenery awaits you at our state of the art park - brand new for Summer 2013. Cheddar Woods is the ideal location for family holidays. Set in an area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, our fabulous park boasts beautifully furnished lodges both to purchase and to book for holidays.
